info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 10 at 9:16PM PDT until August 11 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...Very Low RH and Gusty Winds in FWZs 284, 285, and 624 Thu & Fri PMs... .Gusty south to southwest winds combined with very low RH will lead to critical fire weather conditions Thursday afternoon and evening and, likely, again Friday afternoon and evening across portions of south central Oregon and northeastern California. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM TO 9 PM PDT THURSDAY FOR STRONG GUSTY WIND WITH LOW RH FOR PORTIONS OF FIRE WEATHER ZONES 284 AND 285 IN CALIFORNIA AND PORTIONS OF FIRE WEATHER ZONE 624 IN OREGON... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING FOR STRONG GUSTY WIND WITH LOW RH FOR PORTIONS OF FIRE WEATHER ZONES 284...285 AND 624... The National Weather Service in Medford has issued a Fire Weather Watch...which is in effect from Friday afternoon through Friday evening. * Impacts: Strong, gusty wind with low relative humidity and critically dry vegetation will greatly increase the spread potential of any new and existing fires. * Affected area: - In Northern CA, the northeastern portion of Fire Weather Zone 284 including Lava Beds and Tule Lake as well as northern and eastern portions of Fire Weather Zone 285 including the Modoc Plateau, areas near and east of Alturas, and the Warner Mountains. - In South Central OR, the southeastern portion of Fire Weather Zone 624 including much of Winter Rim, Bonanza, Bly, Lakeview, and Valley Falls. * Wind: South 10 to 20 mph with gusts 25 to 35 mph. * Humidity: 7 to 15 percent. * View the hazard area in detail at: https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD Precautionary/preparedness actions... Avoid tossing burning cigarettes on the ground, parking hot vehicles on dry vegetation, and using equipment that can cause sparks. Follow all fire restrictions. Find links to restrictions at weather.gov/medford/wildfire. One less spark, one less wildfire. Gather your fire evacuation kit now. Collect essentials you don`t want to lose and prioritize your checklist. Visit ready.gov/kit for more information. Familiarize yourself with your evacuation plan. Where will you go? How will you get there? Who will you call to let others know your are safe? Visit ready.gov/wildfires for more information. &&
